intro: Epilobium leptocarpum var. macounii, commonly known as the Macoun's willowherb, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
